name: Sheraton Paris Airport Hotel & Conference Centre

reviews.text: We (my parents, sister, husband, family members and friends) have made frequent trips to Paris since 1967. We used to stay in the city and migrate out to the airport at dawn the morning of our return flight, or worse, spend the night sitting at the Air France gate to be sure we didn't miss the early flight that was the one we invariably were booked on. We nervously wondered if the shuttle would come, if there would be congestion on the road, if the cab driver would kill us before we got there. NO MORE! We are now a lot older and wiser. We found this hotel via our Starwood American Express Card (can you say "points"?) and have been there several times. We did upgrade ourselves to the club floor which entitles you to snacks and drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The hotel is attached tp the terminal and you can roll your baggage to the check-in desk for your flight.
reviews.title: A Great way to End a Paris Visit

reviews.text: The hotel gives the feeling of the interior of a huge ship. It is ultra quiet and sparklingly clean. The desk has never had a problem with our reservations or those of others traveling with us. The rooms are large, modern and comfortablewith coffe and a stocked refrigerator. We absolutely will stay there in the future since most flights back to Texas still have an 8AM or so check-in time. I have witnessed passengers refused boarding because the Metro was delayed, the cab went to the wrong terminal, the shuttle waited for a passenger and was late, and they missed check in. I have actually been able to enjoy the trip home and last minute airport shopping since we discovered this hotel. We normally say our fond farewells to Paris in the evening before our flight, leave our baggage checked at our hotel in the city, call a cab or have arranged for a late shuttle pick-up, informed the Sheraton we would be late arrivals, and had a hassle free departure. Our last trip was February, 2012.
reviews.title: 24hr Stop over

reviews.text: The hotel for this price should reallt have free wifi in the rooms, i upgraded to the club room for an extra 50 euro per night to get access to the free food & drinks, along with wifi, but at a total of 315 euros for 1 night was seriously steep. I would only ever use this hotel if delayed by flight and this hotel has put me off ever using Sheraton chain again.
reviews.title: Great Airport hotel

reviews.text: While on business in Paris I stayed at the Sheraton Paris Airport hotel and was glad I did so. The hotel is very close to the airport and it is really wonderful. Great, spacious rooms with very clean bathroom. Very good service and nice breakfast too. I would stay here again next time I am for business in Paris.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because of a very early flight, and because we got a very, very good rate on a travel website. Had we paid the advertised price on their website (upwards of €219), I would have been horrified- and not due to the price, as one expects to pay a premium for airport hotels. The service at reception was poor- little to no eye contact, and the member of staff preferred to speak with the person she was training rather than me. When I had problems with my 'foreign' credit card, she smirked, and rolled her eyes at the trainee. When asked for my loyalty card, I said I didn't have it with me, and she didn't offer to look it up. I was instructed, after asking, that I contact the membership customer service when I returned to "where I came from".
reviews.title: Best Airport hotel anywhere !

reviews.text: Located in terminal 2, it was wonderful just getting off the plane and walking along some corridors to the hotel. Check in was efficient and professional. Corridors are lit mutely and very calming. Rooms are comfortable, lots of light, tv, tea and coffee making facilities and a mini bar/snacks for which of course you have to pay. We got a very good rate via Hotwire so feel very lucky we got into this hotel. Also they very kindly accepted to keep our luggage for a week until our return on the outbound journey. Wifi is not free except in the lobby...$19 Euro is very stiff for what should be standard in the room. Breakfast in the restaurant; there was no explanation about buffet/a la carte...I realise this is standard in most places however I had to go and get a waitress in order to ask for the a la carte. The menu states that the buffet has eggs cooked to order or you could have scrambled eggs but there was no chef and no eggs on the buffet for at least 15 minutes. The chef was somewhat grumpy and did not like it when his bonjour to a japanese lady was not met with a return bonjour and he said "I said bonjour". I think he would be better off behind the scenes. He did however make me an excellent vegetarian omelette..one of the best I have eaten. As we were leaving I asked for the check to sign - they had put us down for 2 buffets (which by the way were 32 Euros each) instead of one buffet, one a la carte. They corrected it very nicely and efficiently but be aware. Eating here is expensive so you are better off walking through the terminal to find cheaper fare...though there is not a whole lot of choice.
reviews.title: Excellent location for travel out of CDG

reviews.text: It's a good hotel as one can expect from a Sheraton or Starwood property. You get two free small bottles of Evian water but that's pretty much it. I used the business center's Internet to check in for my flight and discovered a few days later that I was charged (only $2.95 though) to use it. Anyway, this hotel is not alone in nickle and diming its customers since big hotel chains do the same.
reviews.title: No such thing as free lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a good hotel for late arrivals or early departures but I have discovered since that there are other hotels in the vicinity of the airport that are more reasonably priced and a short ride on the shuttle. I'll be trying one of them in a few months.
reviews.title: I do not recommend this hotel

reviews.text: The value of this hotel is only with the location. If you do not have an early morning flight out of CDG, there is no reason to stay here. My husband and I stayed here 1 night for that very reason. I would never stay here again. Our room was filthy--burn holes in the carpet. stains on the drapes, mold in the bathroom. When I mentioned it to the clerk at check-out, I was met with indifference. After staying at several lovely boutique hotels in Europe with free WiFi, I was a little surprised that the Sheraton charges 19 euro to use WiFi in our room. Ridiculous.They apparantly get plenty of business because of their location and are not too concerned about keeping customers happy. A stain on the Sheraton brand.
reviews.title: Fine. Walk to terminal. Fly away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night en route from a long trip, NYC to Paris to Marrakech to Paris to NYC. This is a hotel within the airport. It's on the runway, about a one minute walk to Terminal 2. The after hours (11 pm) menu is bizarre and overpriced especially when nothing else is open. The staff was fine. The lobby was bustling. Wi-fi is only free downstairs and not in the rooms. The room was well equipped but also well worn and kind of awkward. It made me laugh - there were so many closets and drawers for a short-trip airport hotel. The storage took up most of the room! We slept there for about 5 hours so I would say it's the best location for a quick turnaround. Also if you're transferring to Orly to CDG, the Air France buses are easy and clean. They run every half hour directly to CDG and cost about 20 euros vs. 80+ euros for a taxi. The bus stops directly in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel, but not cheap!

reviews.text: I had high hopes for the Sheraton at CDG but was ultimately let down once I arrived.
reviews.title: Better Airport Hotel than the Hilton CDG

reviews.text: What I like:
reviews.title: Cold attitude , very efficient transition site.

reviews.text: The location can't be beat. You're right in the middle of the airport that is the CDG mess. The place is the most convenient hotel at the airport.
reviews.title: The most expensive beer ever

reviews.text: The staff is nice. The people I dealt with at check-in and at check out were great. The person in the lounge was excellent. Very helpful.
reviews.title: DON'T DRINK OR EAT Here, unless you have a Swiss Bank Account!!

reviews.text: The room is indeed dead-silent.
reviews.title: Soundproofed hotel perfect for sleeping

reviews.text: I found myself with a 15 hour lay-over in Paris Roissy airport and decided to try out the Sheraton that is right in the middle of the airport. I worried that noise might be a problem given the central location of the hotel but it was absolutely quiet. I purchased a day rate which required me to vacate the room the same day. While expensive it was cheaper than the other hotel alternatives that would have required me to pay for two days to check in at 6:00 am and leave late the same day. The bed was comfortable and the internet was extremely fast. The rooms are modern and clean. All in all it offered me a nice respite in the middle of the chaos that permeates all of Roissy Charles de Gaulle airport.
reviews.title: Respite in the middle of chaos

reviews.text: This was my 4th stay in Sheraton at CDG airport in Paris. As usual, I got my room upgrade, though I cannot see the point. Club rooms look the same as the "general population rooms". Rooms are in the dire need of modernization. Everything works, but furniture is old and used. Bad was hard and unpleasant. Air-con too loud. Room was clean, but that was about it.
reviews.title: Below Sheraton level, even with an upgrade

reviews.text: Breakfast was fair (below SPG and Sheraton standards) without anyone manning the cooking station - which was a major annoyance. Selection at breakfast was also not too spectacular.
reviews.title: Airport Location, But Much More

reviews.text: Staff - definitely below average. They did their job but folks at the reception was clearly annoyed with guests - very unlike my other Sheraton experiences.
reviews.title: Going down-hill fast!
Great Location; but not for me (No internet included in rooms)
reviews.text: All in all, far to expensive for the quality offered. Might come back due to practical location, but will definitely try to avoid in the future.

aka: Sheraton Paris Airport Hotel And Conference Centre
description: Stay connected at the Sheraton Paris Airport Hotel & Conference Centre: the only hotel built directly inside the International CDG Airport Terminal 2. Walk straight from your plane into a warm and welcoming environment. All 240 rooms and 12 suites are fully soundproofed and equipped with the signature bed Sheraton Sweet Sleeper (SM) Bed. Stay in touch with the Link@Sheraton experienced with Microsoft, a unique and convenient online experience.
